boardgame.name: Hangouts, Headquarters, and Hideouts
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

This supplement is devoted to that chief most of heroic requirements: setting up a base of operations that may provide an adequate defense against foes and be a meeting place for other heroes. Many heroes, such as Spider-Man and Daredevil, operate out of their homes, while most groups, such as the Avengers and Alpha Flight, have their own separate headquarters.

This supplement expands the rules for building headquarters featured in the Advanced Player’s Guide and provides additional options for Players and Judges when building their base.

It also features 30 pages of maps covering all sorts of headquarters, and two FULL-SIZE maps covering the classic Defenders Long-Island headquarters and Dr. Strange’s Sanctum Sanctorum!

boardgame.name: Pokémon Scratchees: The Ultimate Test
boardgame.description:
Pokémon battle arena game with fighting, rocks, ground, and water Pokémon. "Gotta scratch 'em all!"

In this scratch off game, two players scratch off challenge spaces revealing Pokémon, Team Rocket, treasures, et. Depending on the revealed icon, players get to scratch off other sections of the card. For example, a duel icon means that you will face off against your opponent in the arena. Each player scratches a space and scores points based on how close the icon is to the player's own power type. The first to reach 25 points is the winner. If all the spaces are scratched off before that happens, the player with the most points is the winner.

In solo mode, the player plays both sides to see who wins. There are 8 scratchee cards in the box.

boardgame.name: Pokémon Scratchees: The Flame Pokémon-athon
boardgame.description:
Pokémon racing game with flying, dragons, fire, electric, and bug Pokémon. "Gotta scratch 'em all!"

In this scratch off game, two players scratch off a square on the track, revealing Pokémon, Team Rocket, treasures, etc. Depending on the revealed icon, players get to scratch off other sections of the card and potentially score points. Whoever collects the most points wins the game.

For solo games, the player plays both sides until a winner is determined.

boardgame.name: SmasHockey
boardgame.description:
The aim of the game is to score the most points by sending the puck into the opponent's goal.

Played facing each other, two players alternately hit the wooden puck with their mini hockey stick. A game is played in 3 rounds and the round ends when one player has accumulated 7 points. Each goal is worth 1 point

boardgame.name: Tiki Toss: Adventure Island
boardgame.description:
Tiki Toss: Adventure Island is a tropical tiki themed dexterity game combined with a traditional roll and move game in which up to 6 players race to be the first to return to the starting point after collecting a set of 5 different colored ring cards. Players earn ring cards at launching pad locations spread across the board. Once at one of these locations, players draw a corresponding ring card and successfully complete all instructions listed on the card. This usually requires players to make one or more successful tiki tosses. A tiki toss consists of a player swinging a metal ring, so that it catches on a hook attached to a tiki pole in the middle of the game board. As players move along paths to and from the different Launching Pads, they will encounter tiki heads that may help or hinder their progress.

—user summary

Your Village is in trouble with the Tiki Forces that be! They are angry and demand 5 Precious Rings in order to spare the Village. Two to Six Villagers are chosen to brave the dangers of Tiki Toss Adventure Island but there can only be one Hero! Can you be the first to collect the five rings (Gold, Silver, Ruby, Emerald, Coral) and return them to the village?

In order to collect the 5 rings, Players must embark on a journey through Quicksand Beach, The Isle of Fire, The Fourth Sister, The Ghost of the Galleon and Head Hunter Hill. Along the way, Tiki Toss skills are essential! Although each player must beware of Sirens, Eruptions, being sentenced to the Pit and more, the biggest challenges can come from an opponent! You may be skipped, reversed or have a ring stolen by an opponent at any time! Trust no one. The stakes are high and the race back to the Village is on!

To be the Hero requires a balance of Luck and Skill! The Dice may be on your side and you may draw the right cards, but do you have the skills of a Tiki Toss Master? Can you handle the pressure?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Suipi
boardgame.description:
Suipi is a classic Samoan card game played using a standard deck of cards, similar in play to "Casino" or "Scopa".

Play starts with four cards being laid face up in the middle of the table, and eight cards being dealt to each player. The goal of the game is to capture the most points by matching cards and building stacks of cards. While regional rules may slightly alter how the game is played, some standard rules apply.

To gather a card from the table, players play a card from their hand which matches a table card in number, or matches the sum of two table cards (if the player has a 9 in their hand, they can gather a 5 and 4 from the table for example). Additionally, cards can be stacked (built) and taken as a stack on the next turn, but only if the player has the stacked number in their hand (for example, a 7 could be built onto a 3 to create a 10, allowing a player with a 10 in their hand to gather the whole stack on their turn). Face cards have no value and can only be gathered using matching face cards.

Additionally, if a player plays a card which matches several cards, stacks, or sums of individual cards on the table, the player may take all those cards. For example, if a player plays a 10 and there is on the table a 10, a stack of 3 & 7, and individually a 6 and 4 the player may take all of those cards as their 10 matches the first individual card, the total stack number, and the sum of the individual 6 and 4 cards.

If a player can not gather a card, they must 'drop' a card onto the table from their hand. If all cards are removed from the table, the player who removed the last card immediately scores 1 point and proclaims 'Suipi!'. The other player must then drop a card to continue the round. "Suipi" is played over 3 rounds, with each round ending when both player's hands are exhausted. Cards on the table remain there between rounds. At the end of the 3rd round, when cards run out of players hands', any cards remaining on the table go to the player which completed the most recent match.

Points are scored per round as follows:
Most cards = 3 points
10 of Diamonds = 2 points
2 of Spades = 1 point
Most Spades = 1 point
Aces = 1 point each
Each Suipi = 1 point (scored during the rounds)


Note: depending on the village the game is learned in, scoring may be slightly different

boardgame.name: Plushie Pier
boardgame.description:
What does it take to be a victorious vendor of Plushie Pier? Selling lots of plushie sets, letting buyers haggle a bit, and boosting POMP! POMP is a local acronym for “place On My Pier.” It basically reflects the popularity, charisma, and overall esteem of your Craft.

Using the cards overlapping mechanic, player for prices of plushies on the pier for sale.
Each time you make a sale, you get a score card matching the icon and quantity of that set. If a player has sold their 8th Plushie, players complete the final round and score.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Horror Trivia Part II: Deeper Cuts
boardgame.description:
150 game cards, each featuring two horror film trivia questions (with answers on the back) and one of five weapon icons in the corner.

A trivia question is read from the card and the currently active team attempts to answer. If successful, the next question is read and they attempt to answer it also. If both answers were correct, they collect the card. Play passes to the next team.
The first team that collects 3 different weapons wins the game!

boardgame.name: 5 Second Rule: Disney Edition
boardgame.description: It should be easy to name 3 Disney dogs - but can you do it under the pressure of 5 seconds twisting down, and with the other players staring at you, waiting for you to get flustered? Time's not on your side, so just say what comes to mind and risk ridiculous answers slipping out as time twirls down on the unique twisted timer! It's all in good fun with this fast-paced game where you have to "Just Spit It Out!"

boardgame.name: Things... Schitt's Creek
boardgame.description:
Everyone’s favorite game meets everyone’s favorite show! In this hilarious game, you read a topic card and then write down your response. It can be anything that comes to mind—there’s no right or wrong answer! Then all the responses are read aloud, and you have to figure out who said what! You won’t believe the THINGS… the people you know will come up with! With the Schitt’s Creek Edition, explore your thoughts about the show and it’s hilarious characters and see what THINGS… you’ll say!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Panorama
boardgame.description:
Panorama is easy to learn with elegant rules! Choose a card from your hand, add it to one of your panoramas, then pass the rest to your neighbor. Cards score based on other cards in your panoramas!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Go Pop!: Hexo
boardgame.description: On a player's turn, they select a line and press down any number of bubbles on that line. The opponent then presses down any number of un-pressed bubbles in a line of their choice. The player left to press the last bubble on the board loses the round.

boardgame.name: Argy Bargey
boardgame.description:
Argy Bargey is a new board game where you compete to create your own canal empire.

Each player must complete routes between towns and cities, competing against each other. Using tiles, you'll want your waterway to take the fastest possible route across the board.

Just like real canals, you'll need to use locks and tunnels to tackle hills. Junctions will be needed to connect other canals and create an efficient network.

With an approximate playing time of 45 minutes, 2 to 6 people can gather to do battle - canal style! Can you become the greatest canal tycoon of the 21st century?

boardgame.name: It's a Wonderful World: Tower Rex Organizer
boardgame.description: Organizer compatible with It's a Wonderful World, including it's expansions. It is designed to provide both efficient storage and improved game play since the trays can be utilised during the game, and they aid set-up and clear-away times.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: It's a Wonderful World: Corruption & Ascension
It's a Wonderful World: War or Peace

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Evil Queen Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Villainous game with these laser etched, laser cut acrylic tokens and 3D-printed storage container!

Set of 16 Poison Apple Tokens - These are for the Wicked to The Core expansion so the Evil Queen doesn't have to use power tokens to represent poison (which can get confusing!). The tokens are 1/4" (6mm) thick so they are sturdy, and they feel as good as they look.

The 3D-printed apple basket is perfect to hold the Evil Queen's collection!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Fate & Locks Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Fate Token - Oooh, shiny! Don't trust your fate to cardboard.

Lock Tokens - Set of five (5) is all you need for the base game and expansions!

These tokens are 1/4" (6mm) thick so they are sturdy, and they feel as good as they look.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Gaston Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Villainous Despicable Plots expansion with these laser etched, laser cut acrylic tokens and 3D-printed storage container!

This set includes 8 acrylic Obstacle/Beast tokens for Gaston (this is the same number as the cardboard pieces that come with the game).

The 3D-printed quiver is perfect to hold Gaston's tokens!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Mother Gothel Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Villainous game with these laser etched, laser cut acrylic tokens and 3D-printed storage container!

Trust Tokens: Help Mother Gothel avoid confusing the trust tokens with the power tokens with this set of twelve (12) sunburst tokens to track her win condition, inspired by the movie "Tangled." These 12 round yellow tokens help Mother Gothel defeat the other villains (she needs to collect 10 to win). They are about 1" across.

The 3D-printed castle opens from the bottom (it screws/on off) and stores Mother Gothel's trust tokens when not in use, and the tokens can go in the top part of the castle tower when playing Villainous.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Pete Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Villainous game with these laser etched, laser cut acrylic tokens and 3D-printed storage container!

Goal Tokens: Put one of these in each of Pete's four realms to set his goals. All 5 are included and they are the same size as the cardboard ones. They are engraved in the correct direction so you can easily take a peek at your goals. They are 1" x 2.25"

Pete's 3D-printed hat pops open to store his goals.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Prince John Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Villainous game with these laser etched, laser cut acrylic tokens and 3D-printed storage container!

Set of 20 Jewel Tokens (10 red & 10 green). The tokens are 1/4" (6mm) thick so they are sturdy and they feel as good as they look.

Prince John's 3D-printed crown is perfect to hold his jewels!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Villain Randomizer
boardgame.description:
Having trouble deciding who gets to play which villain? Just draw out one of these sturdy laser cut tokens and start playing! The villains are grouped by color, so if you don't have a certain expansion you can just remove the tokens that are the same color as that expansion's box.

This set for Disney Villainous comes with 18 tokens (one for each of the current villains available) plus a black velvet pouch to keep them in and draw from.

They are about an inch (25mm) across and 6mm thick. These are laser cut out of beautiful transparent acrylic (not 3D printed!).
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Scar Strength Tracker Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Easily keep track of how much strength Scar has in the succession pile without having to count and re-count with this cool lion's paw rotating score tracker. Evil comes prepared, so equip Scar with this helpful upgrade!

Scar must find and defeat Mufasa, and then must defeat other Heroes in order to have at least 15 Strength in the Succession pile. With this score tracker you can see at glance how close you are to winning it all. Leave the counter face down when you have no strength, and then turn it over and rotate the numbers as needed until you hit 15 for the win.

The counter has numbers 1-20 so you can use it for other games, too (or anything else you want to keep track of!).
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Cauldron & Power Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
A real villain wouldn't have a flimsy cauldron, right? Here's a sturdy upgrade to replace the original and it fits right in the game box!

The 3D-printed cauldron comes with 80 beautiful acrylic crystals that are a combination of purple, green and black to use as power tokens. An additional 40 crystals are also available if you have the expansion.

Because evil can still be beautiful.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: Disney Villainous: LaserLand Lady Tremaine Token Upgrade
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Villainous game with these laser etched, laser cut acrylic tokens and 3D-printed storage container!

The 3D-printed key is perfect to hold Lady Tremaine's 5 Trapped tokens!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Disney Villainous: Wicked to the Core

boardgame.name: The Crew: The Quest For Planet Nine – Meeple Source 3D Upgrade #1
boardgame.description:
A full set of upgraded components for The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine.

Tokens are now bigger in size and three-dimensional! There is also an astronaut figure (2" height) for the commander of the mission. The task tokens have the shape of a spaceship and have a starry night background.

Contents of the set:

- 10 task tokens
- 5 radio communication tokens
- 1 distress signal token
- 1 commander astronaut figure

All parts are 3D-printed in high quality PLA material.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine

boardgame.name: The Crew: The Quest For Planet Nine – Meeple Source 3D Upgrade #2
boardgame.description:
Upgrade kit for The Crew. Finding Planet Nine will be much easier with these wonderful tokens!

The rocket figure is meant to be used as the commander token. It is big and makes it very easy to identify who is in charge!

For easier usage, the radio communication tokens have two different faces: one green and one red.

Task indicators are on top of lander spacecraft miniatures, while the distress signal token is made in a glittery black color that represents the darkness of outer space.

Contents (17 pieces):

- 1 Rocket (commander token)
- 1 Distress signal token
- 5 Radio Communication Tokens
- 10 Task Tokens
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine

boardgame.name: Silent Night
boardgame.description: An event and monster for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Ham's Sandwich Shop
boardgame.description:
There is a small house on the outskirts of town, a sandwich shop run by a hamster chef. The kitchen is busy as the chef snacks on food and the recipes keep changing. Will he be able to make a good sandwich?

Ham's Sandwich Shop is a very cute board game about making delicious sandwiches with a hamster chef who dives on the bread. The game is played by moving the pieces on the topping tiles arranged in a circle forward one to three steps, acquiring one of the topping tiles, and stacking it on top of the desired bread. The recipe changes depending on where the pieces stop, and when they match the recipe, you can declare the sandwich finished. When the sandwich is successfully completed, the player is awarded a gold star. The player who collects three stars wins.

In the middle of the game, a hamster chef tile can dive onto the bread, but only the person who placed the tile knows whether the chef is working or snacking...

English Instructions: https://www.graphic335.com/link4571505530027/rulebook/ham_ru...

boardgame.name: Makrobrains
boardgame.description:
This game was made by wholesale store "Makro" (or "Metro" in Germany) for their 25 year anniversary in the Netherlands. You play this trivia game with 2 to 4 teams of each 2 to 4 players in it. Every team put their pawn (a brain) on the start position. The first team to reach the finish wins.

During your turn you will pick the top card from the pile. On each card there are 2 themes, one on each side of the card, and you have 10 seconds to decide which side you want to play.

After choosing the side you want to play, you get 60 seconds to guess the words written on the card which belong to the theme on the top of the card (Dutch writers, capital cities, Makro employer titles, types of cheese). The team to the right of the playing team is the control team, which tallies how many correct answers are given.

The answers are written on the card but have a red coating over them which makes them almost invisible to read, the game also features a pair of sunglasses with red-tainted glasses which can see through the coating and can read the correct answers (this pair of sunglasses is for the control team).

If no correct answer is given in the first 30 seconds, the first answer is given by the control team as a hint, this answer does not count towards the score. After the 60 seconds are over, the playing team moves their pawn as many spots as their score and then the control team becomes the new playing team.

Furthermore, some spots on the board have a special action like "Go back 3 spots", which goes into effect immediately when a team lands on it, or "if you can at least 5 correct answers next turn, move one extra spot forward" or "Lose a turn", which goes into effect on their next turn. The board has 48 spaces, including the start and the finish space.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Custom Card Sleeves
boardgame.description:
550 custom art card sleeves by Fryxgames. This sleeve set includes 11 packs of sleeves, which is enough for the base game and all its expansion cards:

Type of sleeves included:
- 400 Project card sleeves
- 50 Corporation card sleeves
- 50 Prelude card sleeves
- 50 Global event sleeves

Thickness: 100/120 micron on front/back.

boardgame.name: Kabo Flats
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After escaping Arcpool with law hot on your heels, you arrive in Dormal. This town is known for it's ability to keep secrets and laying low here might help. Unfortunately, the law has caught up to you and armed only with a crude map of the distressed land, you head out into the wilderness!

Although set in the Xobraesal Campaign for six players of second level. this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 17
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A composer flees an immature monarch so that they can compose music in a certain key
A powerful magic relic must be returned to the place of it's origin so a god can finally rest
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 18
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A transformed paladin wants to remove diseases from a cursed pool
Will a god of music have his priests end all human life?
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Spel van het Jaar 1996
boardgame.description:
In this game, each team/players tries to collect the 5 different coloured chips in the game which correspond to the questions on the quiz cards.

All questions are questions about what happened in the Netherlands and the World between October 1995 and October 1996.

The player/teams who rolls the black side of the die starts the game.
On a team/player's turn, they roll the die (yellow, red, purple, blue, green and black).
If they roll the black side, their turn is forfeited.
Otherwise, they have to answer the question on the quiz card which corresponds to the colour they rolled.
Is their answer correct, they gain the chip in that colour.
Is their answer incorrect, the turn goes to the next player.
If a team/player rolls a colour they already have a chip in, they have to answer the question connected to that colour and if they are correct, they may roll again. (normally this isn't the case after a correct answer)
Their turn continues until they either roll the black side, when they answer a question incorrectly or when they obtain a new coloured chip.

boardgame.name: Merc Work
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Knives down. Get on the floor right now, or I swear to whatever brand you worship I’ll put five thousand amps through your chest.” I’m shouting, but it’s dark in the meatpacking room and I’m not sure if any of the clinic techs know who it is that’s yelling at them.

It’s my fault for cutting the power in their building, so I let electricity crawl blue-white up my fingers, lighting my face. I’ve got a mask on; some big faux-wood thing that the art dealer assured me was a tengu--whatever that is. I just know it’s got a nose like a riot baton, and it looks fearsome in the low light.

One of the clinic’s meatpackers screams. The others just look stunned. This kind of thing isn’t supposed to happen here. People like me are supposed to be terrorizing the poor parts of town. As if the poor don’t have enough to deal with.

“Uh-uh,” I say to a woman in a surgical mask who’s lifting a freshly grown liver out of a storage case. “Leave it.” She drops it back into the case with an audible thump. “In fact, you might want to load up a couple more of those and slide them my way. Otherwise, this deranged, criminal cape is likely to start frying little wage-workers.” I let lines of thin blue current lick and snap between my fingers, illustrating the point.

They start putting organs in cases. “So far, so good,” I subvocalize.

The first superhuman was created and patented in 2033 by Prometheus Pharmaceuticals which changed the world. As technological innovation skyrocketed corporation greed grew with it, so the fortunate ones aligned with a corporation prospered. For the unfortunate unaligned masses, they sunk deeper into oblivion. The masses ended up in the crossfire of the Corporate Warfare ignited in 2049. By the end of it, the human population of the fractured states in America had withdrawn into sections of over-crowded cities, huddling amidst concrete, and the wash of neon while the corporate elite remade society in a new image.

Welcome to Dark Times! A tabletop roleplaying game about superpowered people in the Steele City’s corporate slum trying to survive in a civilization swallowed up by corruption and greed. A puppet government functions to do the bidding of the corporations. In Dark Times, the enhanced players must work together to protect their people, try to build up their community, and protect themselves because the corporations seek to enslave them as “Company Property”.

Merc Work is a collection of missions for your friends to enjoy as you run them through roleplaying games scenarios. Unlike many cyberpunk settings in which Cash in Hand is the goal, Dark Times focuses more altruistic characters working to help the downtrodden. Someone must step up to fight against the corporations before things get even worse.

Each mission is complete, so it could be worked into any active storyline. With a little bit of cyberpunk, a little bit of noir, and a whole lot of superpowers, Dark Times mixes old-school and new-school design to create a game that is fast, pulpy, immersive, and fun to play.

boardgame.name: Dark Times NPC Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the book you will find a list of Good guys, Bad guys and ones who are neutral. With each of these characters you will find a brief write up about them, followed by 3 plot seeds to be used in your Dark Times campaign or any type of cyberpunk or supers game.

Following up after the NPCs you will find an adventure for use with Dark Times called Bad Taste. This adventure alone has potential to springboard other missions for the characters.

In Dark Times, players work together with their powers, protect thier people, and build their community, all under the shadow of a corporation that has replaced the government and seeks to enslave them since they are viewed as "company property".

With a little bit of cyberpunk, a little bit of noir, and a whole lot of superpowers, Dark Times mixes old-school and new-school design to create a game that is fast, pulpy, immersive and fun to play.

boardgame.name: Leaving Earth: GeekMod Box
boardgame.description: Wooden box with insert, for storing Leaving Earth and all expansions. Fits sleeved cards.

boardgame.name: Adellos: Wooden Insert
boardgame.description:
In cooperation with “The Game Doctors” they have created an insert that fits perfectly.
It provides room for each unit, the event cards and more.
The inlay is made of wood and not only ensures order in the box, but also removes the annoying sorting of their units from the players.

boardgame.name: Pact of the Legion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Warlock sub-class for 5E that represents the idea of making pacts with a myriad of lesser fiends who grant you, collectively, great power. It is a transformation based class that allows you to take on the form of various fiends.

boardgame.name: Edith Digby's Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

10 new spells for 5E that expand the range of necromatic spells. It includes some damaging, utility, and summoning spells that will help you or your players live out their dreams of commanding hordes of undead.

boardgame.name: EUrotour
boardgame.description:
In this Trivia game about the European Union and its member states, players try to answer questions correctly in order to continue their turn, but if they guess wrong, they might give their opponents an extra turn!

Every player starts on the starting spot.
The player who rolls the highest with the die starts the game.
In your turn, you roll the die and move that amount of places.
You can land on either:

a flag from a country, you then answer a question about the country who belongs to that flag
a spot on the map of a country, you then answer a question about that country
a Star, you then answer a question about the European Union


If you guess correctly, you get and extra turn and can roll again.
If you guess wrong, the next player can try to answer correctly, if any of the other players guess correctly, they save up an extra turn that they can use after their normal turn, but they do not move right now and the turn of the current player is over (unless they saved up an extra turn between their last turn and this one).
If no one answers the question correctly, the turn of the current player is over, unless that player has saved up extra turns between their last turn and this one.
You can save up at most 2 extra turns.

Questions from countries can be in their native language (Finnish, Swedish, Danish, English, German, French, Luxembourgian, Austrian) or they are in Dutch.

When a player reaches or goes over the finish spot, they have to answer one last question about the European Union to win the game. If they answer incorrectly they stay at their spot and get a new question about the European Union the next turn, if they guess correctly their next turn, they still win the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mimikus
boardgame.description:
Each player receives a set of dice, which instead of points have faces in different expressions. The players roll all the dice and place them on the matching starting squares. A special die specifies which die faces may be moved in that round. This die is changed each round. The six different dice faces also offer action possibilities. The winner is the first to draw his 6 dice with different expressions onto the target fields.

—user summary

boardgame.name: All About Columbus, Georgia
boardgame.description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Columbus, GA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Schweine Roulette
boardgame.description: A roulette variant with pig motifs on the bidding cards and on the roulette wheel. Each player has 4 cards in hand, with one suit and one pig position, he can bid up to four suits. Then the wheel is spun, for the winning color with matching pig position there is a winning pig and the bet card, for the right color with wrong pig there is a triple chance card, for the wrong color and the right pig there is a single chance card, but you have to give up the bet cards. If nothing is right, you give away all the cards you have bet. Whoever has a winning pig can challenge another owner and bets on a pig position, if he turns the right one, he gets the opponent's pig, otherwise he loses his own to the opponent. The first to own three winning pigs wins.

boardgame.name: All About Philadelphia
boardgame.description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Philadelphia, PA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Waco, TX depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

boardgame.name: Das große Schlümpfe-Rennen
boardgame.description: In this running/dice game the Smurfs organize a race, each player chooses a figure, the Smurf cards are placed face down on the game board at the beginning. The player on the turn rolls the dice once and moves on by the number of dice rolled, whoever rolls a 6 may roll the dice again and move, foreign figures are skipped, there can be several figures on one field. At the end of the turn, you perform the event that belongs to the square you landed on - on some squares you get cards that bring you to Gargamel's castle or save you from it. The first player to get his figure back to the start/finish square is the winner.

boardgame.name: Geometric Emoji Cube
boardgame.description:
An educational building block game. There are 2 types of wooden cubes: 6 emoticon blocks (each side has a different cartoon expression) and 8 geometric blocks (each side has a different geometric pattern).

Each player starts out with their own set of the chosen cube type and the corresponding deck of puzzle pattern cards face down in a stack. Pick up a card and choose the correct combination of blocks to create the picture on the card. For the victory that takes the shortest amount of time, an hourglass can help keep time.

This is a great way for children to stimulate their attention, exercise fine motor skills, enhance their hand-eye coordination, spatial imagination, logical thinking ability, and practical abilities, and cultivate their hobbies. The cubes are painted with safe, non-toxic, water-based paint.

boardgame.name: Alfa Beta
boardgame.description:
Hooks are in the game, but the game has no hook, but works well! How? Well, you are supposed to fish for the most points and this happens with the longest words possible. In the game there are hooks with two ends, each hook carries a letter, the 74 orange hooks the common letters with value 1, the 14 green hooks the already somewhat more difficult letters with value 2 - B, F, G, H and K - and the 12 red hooks provide the problem cases with value 3 - C, J, P, Q, V, X, W and Z. The underlines on some hooks are wildcards for every other letter. The underscores on some hooks are wild cards for every other letter.

In turn, everyone thinks of a word, preferably with the reachable letters, takes the first letter from the pile, holds the hook vertically and fishes the next letter from the pile with the lower hook, until you have formed a valid word. The letters must be strung in the correct order and direction, otherwise the turn ends. If a letter falls from the hook, the turn also ends without points, letters are always put back. As I said, you can only use reachable letters and must not shuffle the pile. If you have a valid word, you keep it. If all letters are used up or no meaningful word is possible anymore, you win with the most points from the collected words.

A creative variation of the word-building games! Of course, it gets harder as more and more letters go out of play, but in return you may be able to form shorter but more valuable words as difficult letters are uncovered. Creativity, vocabulary and a steady hand are required and deliver fun!

boardgame.name: ホシゾラトリテ (Starry Sky Trick-Taking)
boardgame.description:
Starry Sky Trick-Taking is a 3-player only game in which the players draw constellations on a communal board based upon the cards played to a trick. The specific path(s) drawn are determined by the majority color played and the majority high/low numbers played, and the path is drawn by the winner of the trick.

Play continues until players have 1 card left in hand. In addition to their traditional rank, the cards also show a bid number for how many points the drawn constellations will be worth. The winner of the game is the player whose bid was closest to the value of the constellations.

boardgame.name: Till the Last Damn Bullet
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Till the Last Damn Bullet is a western themed one-page TTRPG where you play dauntless gunslingers trying to carve their names in history.

You are riding west, followed by the sun and by the shadow of your enemies. Your next adventure awaits! Are you skilled enough to become legend or will you shoot your last bullet? Play to find out!

Number of players: 2-5
Age: 10+
Duration: 2-4 hours per gaming session

boardgame.description:
Increase your party size in Free Roam! Bring up to 8 people to the table with this add-on which allows up to 8 players to participate in Free Roam modes.

Contains:

4 player boards
extra player token sets
30 cube tokens
10 double-sided character cards
9 custom dice
4 game save boxes
45 equipment cards


Note: while all Free Roam modes are compatible with this increase in players, the standard campaigns are not.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Death Downs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the third of many adventures in the Quick Encounters product series for Five Torches Deep by ThrowiGames, LLC These short to mid-sized books are designed as random encounters or small one-session scenarios for use when a GM has little time to prepare. Each of these products will initially be available as PDFs but may be printed as a single volume at a later date. Note that while the adventure was written for Five Torches Deep, it will use the ThrowiGames Sensory Descriptive Style (SDS) format.

The Death Downs is a vast burial mound of noble families and great warriors. Characters will dis-cover great riches and wealth if they can survive the burial ground’s traps and evil undead.

This adventure was designed for 2-4 characters of seventh to ninth level. Groups without one or two zealots may not survive its horrors.

boardgame.name: Titan's Crater
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the second of many adventures in the Quick Encounters product series for Five Torches Deep by ThrowiGames, LLC These short books are designed as random encounters or small one-session scenarios for use when a GM has little time to prepare. Titan’s Crater takes characters into a magical crater overflowing with unbridled energy. A nearby town capitalizes on the misfortune of those who try to harness its unstable power and fail.

This adventure was designed for 2-4 characters of second level.

boardgame.name: Solarpunk Futures
boardgame.description:
Solarpunk Futures is a 10-minute rules-light role playing game where players imagine the pathways to a desirable world from the perspective of a utopian future.

Players use a deck of cards to remember Ancestors (e.g. grower, engineer, newcomer) and work together using Tools (e.g. recycled materials, equipment library, off-grid energy) and Values (e.g. care, responsibility, usufruct) to overcome a set of real-world Challenges (e.g. borders, ableist infrastructure, climate refugee crisis). Through dialogue and collaborative worldbuilding, collective and visionary narratives emerge of a new society, along with plausible scenarios for how to get there.

The players are guided through a collaborative storytelling process, imagining the pathway to their utopian future. In a conversation that can range from solemn to comical in tone, the players decide collectively how they worked together and why it took all of them to overcome the Challenge.

—description from the publisher

Planning to take your players to a destroyed city in the sky?

This battlemap is perfect for you! It features a ruined sky port, with holes blasted in the roads. Rubble litters the broken streets, while fluttering tents and storage barrels can be found throughout the city. Further down are the roofs from houses in the lower levels of the city, and below them, clouds drifting by.

This Ruined Sky City Battlement 40x30 battlemap is made in a realistic style that’s designed to encourage creative and tactical play via good level design. Plus, it comes ready for VTTs or easy home printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions.

Roll the dice to have the Necronomicon decide your fate & which Killer/Location combination you should play.

boardgame.description:
They say the third time's the charm, but in this third expansion of Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar, there's precious little charm to be found . . .

The Gutbuster Mawtribe are obese, gluttonous, bloodthirsty ogors whose hunger for combat is as acute as their hunger for everything else. The Ossiarch Bonereapers are highly disciplined troops loyal to Nagash. You can serve them in life or serve them in death – they aren’t picky.

Contents: 112 cards in a tuckbox.

boardgame.name: The Great City Battlement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Planning a session involving the defence or invasion of a highly fortified city?

This map was made for battle! It’s painted in a realistic style, showcasing the spiked stone walls mounted with murder holes and ballista. A drawbridge serves as the only access point over the fast-flowing river that was diverted around this city as a moat. And beyond the drawbridge waits a heavy iron portcullis, guarding the plunder in the city beyond.

With this map and its detailed adventure prompt, you can bring your dreams for your next session to life! The map cones ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing, saving you precious preparation time so you can do more of what you love instead.

boardgame.name: Underground City Battlement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking to battle over a fortified underground city?

This battlemap features a massive battlement built into the side of a mountain. It’s stone walls are filled with murder holes and ballista. A drawbridge serves as the only access point over the fast-flowing river that functions as a moat. And beyond the drawbridge waits a heavy iron portcullis, guarding the city beyond.

With this map and its detailed adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Cerulean Jungle Caverns

Looking for a colourful sci-fi cavern system?

This map features an underground cavern filled with alien, colourful flora and fauna. Orange moss coats the ground, while cyan trees and shrubs grow from the tough soil. Nearby, green water flows past. Even the stones itself have strange, colourful patterns in it!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring dryads, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

Step into a cavern where time hasn’t flowed forward, and the locals know little about the outside world. Rudimentary huts and timber bridges form walkways above the colourful ground. Orange moss coats the stone floor, while cyan trees and shrubs grow from the tough soil. Nearby, green water flows past. Even the stones itself have strange, colourful patterns in it!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

Looking for a cave filled with crystals and flowing water?

Look no more! This cavern is designed to be extra engaging during combat, encouraging creative and tactical play from your friends. It also looks beautiful, too; it has gorgeous colourful crystals, alien patterns in the floor, and a flowing stream that runs beneath the stone.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Overgrown Alien Crystal Waterways

Looking for a water-filled cave?

This map is flooded almost everywhere by ankle-deep water. Colourful crystals stand tall throughout the cave, while greenery lines the walls. Some paths are above the water line, however on all the stone floor there are strange, alien patterns.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Thermal Crystal Lava Caverns

This map is beautiful, and you should buy it :P

Seriously though, the crystals in this cavern are glowing with a beautiful, orange light that sets the mood in this cave so well. Embers dance in the air, and just by looking at this map I feel like breathing would scorch my lungs.

Magma flows beneath a stone floor, carved with strange patterns which glow from the molten stone running beneath them. The magma bubbles, and the heat sears your skin. The crystals themselves radiate a strange heat from the inside, and are prized throughout the realms for just that reason.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

Looking for underwater caverns to drown your players in?

Light ripples beautifully across the ground here, and sand pools in tiny dunes over a strange stone floor. There are patterns carved in it which glow a faint blue. Schools of fish dart throughout this cave system, while seaweed sways and little pipe-worms make their tubular homes. The current is gentle here, carrying your form gently in its arms…

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

Winter has come.

This glacial cave creaks and moans, as if the very walls are alive—and unwelcoming. Water runs and drips down the sides of frozen walls, while below your feet sheets of ice crack and crunch. There are glowing crystals in this cavern, crystals which seem to have a light of their own flickering and dancing beneath their surface…

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

Looking for a creepy temple map?

This temple is filled with bloody water, demonic statues, and broken crypts. Intricate floor tiles lay broken and covered with rubble. Glowing red skulls sit on a strange altar, and there is treasure as well as ancient scrolls elsewhere throughout the dungeon.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving removing a dark curse from the with a heart-warming twist, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). boardgame.name: Baby Dinosaur Rescue
boardgame.description:
The dinosaurs need your help! The big volcano is about to erupt, and all of the dinosaurs need to get to the island before the lava fills the valley. Work together to move all of the dinosaurs through the valley and onto the island.

In this cooperative game, kids ages 4+ will work together to move all the dinosaurs across the board and onto the islands. Players use one of their cards to move a dinosaur onto a matching space on the board. The dinosaurs don’t share spaces, so players can get the dinosaurs really moving by playing the same item card twice and jumping over other dinosaurs! Mixed into the item cards are lava cards and when a player draws a lava card the lava moves one space closer to the valley. Players must get all the dinosaurs onto the island before the lava token reaches the bottom of the volcano.

The bright and colorful image-based gameplay makes Baby Dinosaur Rescue easy to learn and fun to play! Once players know the rules there is no reading required which makes this a fun way for kids to use basic strategy skills and reduces competition by having the players work together to beat the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Princess Heroes
boardgame.description:
Help the Princess Heroes race to the castle! The castle has been cursed and all of the princesses must get through the enchanted forest and make it to the castle before the last leaf from the tree of life lands on the ground. Work together to help the princesses defeat all the obstacles and make it to the castle before the leaf reaches the ground to break the curse.

In this cooperative game, kids ages 4+ will work together to help move all of the princess heroes across the board and into the castle. Players use their item cards to move a princess onto a matching space on the board. The princesses don’t share spaces, so players can get the princesses really moving by playing the same item card twice and jumping over the other princesses. Mixed into the item cards are obstacle cards. These obstacles take time to overcome and when a player draws an obstacle card, the leaf token falls one space closer to the ground. Players must get all of the princess heroes back to the castle before the leaf token reaches the ground and the castle curse cannot be broken.

The bright and colorful image-based gameplay makes Princess Heroes easy to learn and fun to play! Once players know the rules there is no reading required, which makes this a fun way for kids to use basic strategy skills and reduces competition by having the players work together to beat the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Baby Dinosaur Alphabet
boardgame.description:
Complete the dinosaurs and learn the alphabet by matching the two dinosaur halves together! The dinosaurs have been all mixed up, but you can help get them back together by matching the front and back half of the dinosaur by the image or by matching the first letter of the dinosaur type with the first letter of the dinosaur’s name.

Baby Dinosaur Alphabet is an easy to learn matching game for toddlers as young as two! With multiple ways to play, help kids learn image-based memory and matching skills, letter recognition, and the alphabet. Players start by spreading out the cards face down, and on their turn, they will flip over 2 cards. If the cards are a match, they set the pair aside. If the cards do not match, players will have to remember where they were and find the other matching pieces on their next turn! The player who creates the most matching pairs wins!

The colorful cards are a fun way to learn the alphabet and can help toddlers develop new skills. Kids can play on their own, against their friends, or cooperatively to match all the dinosaurs together!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: My First Dragon Adventure
boardgame.description:
Race to the mountain top and convince the dragon to save the smore’s! The magical marshmallow fire in the kingdom has gone out, and it’s up to the heroes to race to the dragon’s nest and convince the dragon to help them relight the fire. Players move their hero through the lands collecting keys for hidden shortcuts and gems for the dragon, trying to be the first one to reach the dragon’s nest. Once players reach the nest, they will roll the dice and offer the dragon gems to convince them to come and help the kingdom.

In My First Dragon Adventure, kids will race through the different lands, using numbered cards to jump ahead, while trying to become the hero of the kingdom. But they better watch out! Along the way there are obstacles to avoid and gems to collect. Players move along the board by using their numbered cards to move ahead. Strategically use your cards to avoid landing on obstacles, pick up special items, and slow other players down. Once players reach the dragons nest, they roll the dice to see how the dragon will respond. The first player to make it to the nest and convince the dragon to help is the winner!

Colorful and detailed images make this story driven game a great way to help kids develop their strategic thinking and counting skills. Limited reading and basic counting make this an easy game for kids aged 5+ to learn and enjoy!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Ensnared
boardgame.description:
2-6 players take the roll of jungle animals learning the art of escape using the wisdom of their mentors. While hanging upside down in snares, players play oxygen sets or runs on themselves and blood sets or runs on an opponent.

When a player has played all of their cards, the player with more oxygen than blood is the master of escape.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rendalir Remembered
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rendalir Remembered is a live action roleplaying game based out of Southern California. It's a dark fantasy game with a heavy emphasis on roleplay and player driven story. It is a game of colliding cultures, of battles fought in courts and minds as much as with sorcery and steel. The world of Rendalir offers immense cultural diversity, populated only by the gods, their children, and humans. Above all, this game is about one race, one species, interacting only with the many variations of themselves, and surviving in a world where powerful beings walk among them everyday, able to do as they wish.

The story for Rendalir Remembered is driven by player choice and consequence. Players have the opportunity to be heroes, but are not guaranteed success. Everything will be up to YOU. Heroes are not born. They are made. If you want to be a hero, you must earn it.

boardgame.name: Arcane Ascension
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Arcane Ascension takes place on the continent of Kaldwyn, where six colossal towers – known as the Soaring Spires – grant power to those who are brave enough to undergo the tests within. This game takes place in between the events of the War of Broken Mirrors novel series and the Arcane Ascension novel series. Participants can read these novels for a greater understanding of the style of the game world, but this is not in any way required.

boardgame.name: Mythralis Regional Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Arcane Ascension, players can either play as refugees from the continent of Mythralis, or natives to the continent of Kaldwyn. Players who are making characters from Mythralis are recommended to read the Mythralis Regional Guide, and players who are making characters from Kaldwyn are encouraged to read the Kaldywn Regional Guide.

boardgame.name: Kaldywn Regional Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Arcane Ascension, players can either play as refugees from the continent of Mythralis, or natives to the continent of Kaldwyn. Players who are making characters from Mythralis are recommended to read the Mythralis Regional Guide, and players who are making characters from Kaldwyn are encouraged to read the Kaldywn Regional Guide.

boardgame.name: The StarComm Wars
boardgame.description:
The StarComm Wars is a game of economic warfare simulating the Helion wars of 2312 to 2317. Players take on the roles of merchant companies and of the ill-fated Helion Imperium in an attempt to survive and prosper.

Two introductory scenarios introduce the merchant mechanics and how to play the Imperium. There is then one short and one full campaign scenario. The game is for 2-5 players, with one player representing the Imperium, against 1-4 merchants.

boardgame.name: The Arbiter System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Arbiter System is a game rules set designed for live-action role-playing games (“LARPs”).
...
This specific system was first designed for use in Shades of Venaya, which ran until 2014. The system is tailored toward use in the same universe as Venaya, with some elements of the game mechanics being designed to properly represent the narrative elements of that world. For example, the setting has a detailed magic system with internally consistent rules.

The philosophy behind the Arbiter System is that each player should be able to create a character that is unique and fun to play right from their first game. For this reason, characters start with a comparatively large number of skills, and the system has a wide variety of different skills to choose from. In addition, different game regions also have unique skills for that region, and many other skills can be found through game play and purchasing “Lore” skills, which provide the player with additional role-playing information and more skills to consider purchasing.

In addition, the Arbiter System is designed for long-term play. For this reason, many skills have “soft caps”, where the skill gets progressively more expensive to purchase until it is very inefficient, rather than “hard caps”, where there is a clear maximum level for each skill. This system also provides incentives for retiring your character and starting a new one to encourage players to try new things and allow newer players to catch up.

boardgame.name: minimum - light, easy, fast
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The idea behind this simple ruleset is to allow for fast preparation and fast games even between people that never played before. The system is loosely based on B/X and Old School D&D editions but it’s intended to be setting neutral, consistent and streamlined. The players should be able to read the rules, create a character and start playing in less than 30 minutes.

boardgame.name: Postcard Civil War East
boardgame.description:
Little postcard size/format boardgame about the American Civil War in the East to mail/give to family&friends.
6 turns per year, 1861-65, but just a single year's campaign can be played. 7 Union and 5 Confederate pieces. Lots of Fog of War, Jackson's Foot Cavalry II Corps while it lasts, etc. A one-year campaign plays in ... 15 minutes? ... so the 5-year war (unless someone wins sooner) ... 75 minutes?
Simple, basic mechanics.

(Union player:) "Wherrre's Jackson?!"

—description from the designer

Screams and Whispers contains nine stand-alone scenarios for KULT: Divinity Lost. They follow a variation of themes and touch upon different genres of horror, all firmly rooted within the KULT mythology. All scenarios are designed to be pick-up-and-play.

boardgame.name: The Dishonourable Directory of Mercenary Companies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mercenaries are the high school bullies to your adventuring parties new kid in town. They're bigger than you, more numerous and liable to take an instant dislike to you. One or two of them may even have a weirdly ominous laugh. This product contains the details of twenty original and occasionally creative mercenary companies, perfect to serve as rivals, enemies or if things go really well employees.

boardgame.name: Vigilant: A Player's Guide for Character's Level 1-10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A brutal fantasy ttrpg with deep tactical combat and open-ended character progression! Easy to pick up and jump in a game, but challenging to even consider mastering, Vigilant provides a unique tabletop experience for veteran role-players, combat junkies, and newcomers alike.

Vigilant is a game built for players who like having thousands of options and choices at any given time within the system. With countless viable ways to approach encounters as both the player and GM, Vigilant ensures that your adventurers will always face new and exciting challenges, and that even identical characters can have vastly different play experiences. Of course, this is all wrapped up neatly in a tight system that has had all the fat mercilessly stripped from it by our expert rules-butchers, so you can get right down to pounding goblins into the cold hard stone of the dungeon floor.

Play as a hulking bipedal catfish that can headbutt their way through a wall, a manic investigator whose very presence puts others on edge, a deranged healer who derives their power from alien gods, a wild sorcerer constantly at risk of having their head explode, or thousands of other combinations of archetypes, races, and perks! Vigilant puts the tools in your hands to create wild and spicy characters, or a classic edgy rogue with no friends!
